cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (160 km) south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across central-western Cuba Monday, then turning north-northwest across the Florida Straits and tracking just offshore the southwest Florida coast toward the Tampa Bay region Tuesday night before curving inland over Florida’s Big Bend on Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast near the Big Bend region (around Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West coast of Florida from Flamingo northward to the Anclote River, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect only for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas (not including Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West coast of Florida from Bonita Beach northward to the Suwannee River, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–50 mph) are likely Tuesday night into Wednesday with a low (11 %) chance of reaching 50-kt intensity and very low chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC Storm Surge Watch indicates 2–4 ft of inundation possible in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 2–4 inches with isolated totals up to 6 inches, producing potential urban and flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday night–Tuesday; rough seas and dangerous surf that will disrupt vessel traffic and berth operations.
